feed.title: Combined summary - [ann] Bitcoin Core version 0.9.2 has been released

entry.title: Combined summary - [ann] Bitcoin Core version 0.9.2 has been released
entry.summary: Bitcoin Core version 0.9.2 has been released with the latest version of OpenSSL, which fixed a recently-discovered security flaw. The upgrade is recommended as it brings back the compatibility of Linux builds with old distributions like Debian 6+, Tails, Ubuntu 10.04 and CentOS 6.5. The release notes contain important changes such as per-peer block download tracking and stalled download detection, lower paytxfee warning threshold from 0.25 BTC to 0.01 BTC, and fixes for various coin control visual issues. The deterministic build system used for Windows and Linux builds is now available for OSX as well. In an email conversation between Jesus Cea and Wladimir on June 17, 2014, Wladimir reported an issue while running bitcoin-qt under Ubuntu 10.04. Specifically, he received a "symbol lookup error" stating that there was an undefined symbol "_ZN10QTextCodec11validCodecsEv". Jesus asked if the issue occurred with the release candidate. Wladimir stated that they have built against Qt 4.6 for Linux and filtered the symbols for libstdc++ and glibc to bring back compatibility with Debian 6+, Tails, Ubuntu 10.04, and CentOS 6.5. However, under Ubuntu 10.04, Jesús Cea Avión encountered an error when trying to run bitcoin-qt in the /tmp/bitcoin-0.9.2-linux/bin/64 directory. The error was a symbol lookup error with an undefined symbol: _ZN10QTextCodec11validCodecsEv. Users are advised to report possible regressions on Github.
